channel.title: XNA Game Studio
channel.description: XNA is a tool put out by Microsoft around a year or two ago that lets you make games for Xbox 360 using c#. It is free if you want to make the games for windows (computers) but for the 360 you need to get a membership which is $99 a year, and you need xbox live. The site that all this is at is www.xna.com, if you want to download XNA go to http://creators.xna.com/en-US/downloads. I suggest getting 3.0 if you have a Zune, since the XNA team announce that you can make games for them with 3.0. You will also need visual studio c# 2005 express edition (free, its on the downloads page i gave you for those of you who are to lazy to go look). Also, Microsoft accidentally leaked that they would pay $1000+ for the rights to the games if they are big enough hits on xbox live (I can't find the article on this anymore :\). If you have any questions feel free to ask me, ill do my best to find an answer for you.

item.title: XNA Game Studio
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:14, topic:230257”][quote author=reVein link=topic=303091.msg2432359#msg2432359 date=1220969125]

“Come create our games for us!”

[/quote]u get paid so it doesnt matter, nomsain

You’re paid $1000 for a years work, they’re paid 1000 a minute atleast for your work.[/quote]
If they want the game they’ll pay what you want Within reason lol

EDIT: Unless they make you agree to some contract before letting you even put it on for Review on Xbox Live?

m.dog311:

I hope it doesn’t break as easily as the original lol.

The PSP 2000 is far less durable than the original 1000. <3 my phat.

item.title: XNA Game Studio
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:6, topic:230257”]Yeah but that could change soon since they announced a psp store like they have with the ps3, They’re looking to bring the psp back and if they do get the same quality games on the psp store as they do on the ps3 store then i’ll definatly start using my psp again.

So yeah, i can see sony investing in some of these indie devs to start making these ‘original’ titles for the psp store.[/quote]
I’m betting it will come hand in hand with the PSP 3000 (which has been confirmed, btw).

Read full topic

item.title: XNA Game Studio
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Thug-life:

Sony already do support indie developers, if you have a good idea and the ability to program they’ll fund the project, equipt you with development kits and give you access to all of their first party studio’s.

Hm, I might have to look into that (and learn the languages needed first).

Read full topic

item.title: XNA Game Studio
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yeah but that could change soon since they announced a psp store like they have with the ps3, They’re looking to bring the psp back and if they do get the same quality games on the psp store as they do on the ps3 store then i’ll definatly start using my psp again.

So yeah, i can see sony investing in some of these indie devs to start making these ‘original’ titles for the psp store.

Read full topic

item.title: XNA Game Studio
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Thug-life:

Sony already do support indie developers, if you have a good idea and the ability to program they’ll fund the project, equipt you with development kits and give you access to all of their first party studio’s.

It’s quite the opposite for the PSP. $5000 SDK and development box plus hardcore testing and licensing.
